comment: Professor Soiset is awesome. I have never had to work so hard to get an A in a history class, but at the same time I appreciate to actually have to think and listen. His lectures are great! the only thing I would advise is that you sit upfront, because he talks very quietly

Soiset was an awesome teacher. Lecture heavy, but else do you expect from a history class? Lectures with Powerpoints and, you have announced quizzes which you get to use your notes you took in class that day, and you have test which he reviews with the class before hand. I don't know how to explain it any easier. If you fail its your own fault.
He rambles a lot about things that aren't on the tests. Random quizes at the end of class. Likely to fall asleep during lectures. Random video days.

He's a nice but boring professor who gives monotone lectures with PPT photos. His exams are theoretically easy, but a lot of it is content that he doesn't review in his exam reviews. Not only that, he's very unclear about a lot of things, like on the 1500 word paper he makes you write at the end of the semester.

I loved Prof. Soiset.  He was a good lecturer and engaged students.  He was very kind and helpful if you asked.  He was great about his "pop quizzes", he would warn the day before and sometimes the day of, that there would be a quiz at the end.  He is fairly quiet, so sit up front!

Soiset is a rather good professor. He knows his material, and generally follows his powerpoint and explains events. He throws the occasional pop quiz into the mix, and has 3 or 4 tests throughout the semester. He can be kind of hard to hear, so you might want to sit closer to him. Gives terms for tests and usually gives essay topics as well.

I am a visual learner so his class was a bit challenging for me. Pros:  -friendly and wants to help by giving extra credit a lot -tests are not hard word for word on study guide -talks a lot so great for auditory learners Cons: -doesn't post adequate notes online they suck -tends to go off topic a lot and miss key vocab words -pop quizzes

Okay, I'll go ahead and say the biggest con to Soiset is that he tends to be very quiet when speaking so you have to listen closely. He is very passionate about what he teachers, and he sure knows what he's talking about. He will give you a study guide for each test and if you do it thoroughly you will pass with an A (Some info is online).

Going into the class I had expected to hate it as I never wanted to take any of these "core classes", completely unrelated to my major. Although I'm not going to remember any of this down the road and this information isn't beneficial to me, I still like the class -- it's one of my favorites.
Really good professor. Extremely easy as long as you do the assignments and your assigned readings.
Attendance is important because the tests are based entirely on the notes taken during lectures. Haven't used the book once. There are also a few pop quizzes throughout the semester.

I HATED this class. I am a visual learner, which means I need powerpoint, some written notes, SOMETHING. All he does is talk the whole time and you're expected to write notes on what he says. Would not recommend this class to someone who can't stay awake during history or anyone who hates lecture-heavy classes. Also, you don't even use the book.

Great Professor. he has funny anecdotes, and he definitely knows a lot from experience. He mostly talks from his head instead of reading off of slides or anything, and it feels like hes talking to you instead of reading to you. Also do the extra credit to get an easy A. Tests difficult but you should be prepared if you have the terms he gives out.
He knows his stuff. His tests are easy if you take good notes AND study them beforehand. He has a review day before each test as well. He also grades his tests relative to the highest grade.

A great professor who did more than just read history off of sheets of paper. He had an intricate knowledge of the material he was teaching, and I managed to get an A without studying more than an hour for each test, yet I learned more than I have in any prior history class. His personal stories bring it to life, and I would take him again any day.

A great professor with excellent stories. He teaches the material in an open discussion format with great stories. He shares personal stories from his times in Vietnam. Attendance required, but he will excuse most anything you tell him. There were several texts, an A was possible without them (they were all cheap though).
This guy really knows his stuff. He's also pretty entertaining. It's a bit challenging though. If you're looking to take this course, his class his a great option.

Had him for Vietnam and every other HIST class I've had at SPSU. Hands down my favorite professor here, not only is his teaching style great, he goes into depth with stories, backdrops, and war stories. If you ever get a chance to take any HIST classes or Vietnam do it. Highly recommended. If you're into history, you'll enjoy his lectures.

Is the best professor i have had in history. He really knows the material. He is very helpful and gives alot of extra credit. The test are not that easy, but you can definetly get an A if you try hard and do alot of extra credit. Highly recommended.

good guy, but dont ask him about your grade to much. knows his stuff. listen and take notes and you will do fine. he goes over all the vocab on the tests AND alot of the test questions AND essay topics. extra credit also avalible. easy A would reccomend

He knows his stuff, he is very nice, gives many extra-credit opportunities, curves tests, and drops the lowest.  BUT, entire class period is one big lecture - LOTS OF NOTES!  For 4 tests, there was a total of 300+ terms.  Lots of memorization!
He is a great teacher! Gives you plenty of chances to bump your grade, he is very helpful. All his tests are from his notes, so you dont even need the book. Take him!
Great guy. Really enjoyed talking to him before class. If you have the opportunity, take one of Soiset's classes. You will not regret it.

He knows the material and relays it well. Gives fair tests and usually gives a curve. He gives an option of a research paper or presentation and the presentations are easy to do and graded very easy. One of my better history professors. Don't need to buy the text it isn't used just take good notes and you should pass.

He is the nicest professor I have ever had. I took him my first year. If you ask him for extra help he will surely help you. He drops your lowest test and if you are lucky he might take your highest twice. If you make an A you dont need to take the final. He asks for one project tho.. but no big deal its easy. Fair grading, I give him an A+.
RUN FAR AWAY!!!! HE IS SO DISORGANIZED, HE JUMPS FROM SUBJECT TO SUBJECT WITHOUT WARNING AND HIS TEST ARE HARD AS HELL!!! GO WITH VICKREY!!!

Never bought book, came out with A in class. A few questions on his tests are geography based,  but most of those are optional essays (he'll give you three and say write one). Knows his stuff very well and relays it easily, office hours are not very flexible, but they're very valuable. Always asks for concerns and questions before tests.

Very nice! Might get off the subject sometimes, but he knows his stuff. Willing to work with you. You can't fail unless you just don't try. Gives a study guide and have an open discussion for any questions before each test. Easy class & Friendly professor!
A teacher who loves what he does and a really nice person.  He lets you drop one test grade.

Don't even bother buying the book. Totally worthless. The entire test is based on his lectures, so be sure to write everything down and try not to miss classes. He gives you a review of the test. MAKE SURE TO ASK HIM QUESTIONS ON THE TERMS YOU DO NOT KNOW BEFORE THE TEST. The tests are not easy, but he gives you a curve. Write notes, get an A.

Great teacher. Class was very easy; all you have to do is read the review and copy it down twice. That Simple. I would opt for the powerpoint; he gives higher grades. Attendance isn't mandatory but you will need to come if you want to pass the class, because he rambles and doesnt put some info on the review sheet. I barely did the work and got an A

Great teacher! He really made the class interesting. Tests are tough, but as long as you do the review, not too bad. Take notes! He has quizzes that you can use them on! If you are having trouble, don't be afraid to ask for help. He is willing to help you. I would recommend him.

best teacher at the school. makes the class very interesting. the test are a little hard unless you pay attention and do the review sheet. make sure to take notes, he will give quizzes that you can use them on.

Very nice professor. The only history class I've ever enjoyed. His tests aren't bad, as long as you do the entire review sheet you'll be okay. We had to do one research paper, on basically anything to do with the class. Attendance isn't mandatory, but notes are really important for his class. But, I skipped a lot of classes and still got an A.

Awesome guy! His ancient history class is absolutely fascinating! The tests are taken directly from the notes and there is really no need for the textbook, except for a few maps here and there. Professor Soiset is the nicest and one of the most comical professors on campus, take him !!
Very easy. Talk to him if you ever have problems and he is willing to help and work schedules out for you. Gives extra credit if you ask. Awesome teacher!
He is a good teacher and you can easily get an A finally. Review the key terms he give you, you will be fine~
very nice teacher...tries to make class interesting...you'll have to do one easy research paper
Awesome professor, would love to take again.

If you've gotta have an STS class for your major, look for Soiset and his Vietnam class.  He does a great job with it and is a Vet himself.  Its a great class and helps boost your GPA.  Not too much work, and fairly interesting material.
I take his World and American History and STS course. It is easy to get A. his nice.

Professor Soiset's STS class covers the Vietnam era. Be prepared to make a 10 - 15 minute presentation on a subject he chooses, as well as write a position paper and annotated bibliography. There was no final exam. His grading of your presentation is rather lenient, I made a couple of mistakes and still got an 'A'.

Pretty cool guy. Im not very good in history and got B's in all the classes i took with him.  If you need help go to his office and he will do just about anything for you to get your grade up.  Tests are kind of tricky, oh and TAKE NOTES all of them the whole class!
Easy "A". He is very helpful and understanding.
Very informative, very fair.

Very interesting and amusing - lots of stories and personal experience with the subject. TAKE NOTES. What he talks about most is what's on his test. Kind of quiet but go out of your way to get to know him. He really cares about his students. Straight lecture, no homework but one paper. Defenitely recommended.

Very very nice man and extremely intelligent. He knows exactly what he's talking about.  No cumulative final. You have to take notes because you he doesn't really teach the same as the book. Important to go to class to get those notes but he doesn't take roll. Very lenient and tests are not bad.
Nice guy. Always willing to help students out. Get to exempt the final if you have an A at the end of the semester.

Great teacher! Very nice with a little sense of humor.  Is very clear about what he teaches, and he knows his history.  No attendance policy, however, it is beneficial to attend class as there are notes pretty much every day.  Tests are pretty easy if you study a little bit for them.  Recommend to anyone!

very good teacher, need a answer, call him, send email... his tests are easy, just take some notes and make sure u know everything in the handout be4 the test, you should be fine! and his jokes sometimes are really funny! and no need for reading book be4 class!
an excellent professor.  his test reqires good note taking skills to score good on his tests.  review sheets are simple( just look the questions up in the book) pay attention and you will do well.

A friend recommended this class and I'm glad I took his word. He's very lenient on the grading, there's like one easy project and one easy paper to hand in, and then student evaluations which take about 2 minutes to fill out. Plus he ended class way early even though it was a summer class! enjoyable++. TAKE HIM

Great Teacher. knows his stuff. Don't need book. Hates when you ask what chapter since he only has a book since the univesity requires it. Did my paper on the Althing it took some times but got a 100.

He has become one of my favorite professors at SPSU, reading the book is not necessary if you attend his class every class time. He teaches history as if he was right there when it was all happening...I enjoyed his lectures, and his jokes sound dry but theyâ€™re very funny (if u catch it, that is)

a bit dry at times, but once you start to learn to enjoy his sense of humor, he's a pretty entertaining teacher. if you take good notes in class, you'll have no problem getting an A without buying the book. lets you know what will be on the test via studyguide.  one of SPSU's better teachers IMO

Teaches history as if he were telling a story, very easy to follow and enjoyable to hear. One major paper. 3 tests. You can find answers to other questions in the test. Very nice class. No attendance policy.
Very nice professor. A little boring occasionaly, but as a whole he is good. I got all A's on his tests and quizes. Take him if you can.
take him if he can.. Hes great!!

took ancient workd history. He is easy. Gives a lot of words to know for test, but not to difficult. Final exam is optional. Assigns a presentation, but he grades so easy you're bound to make an "A" on that as well.
very patient, helpful. easy class.
just study....

One of my favorite teachers at SPSU.  From what I've noticed he teaches all his classes the same way (US Hist II, Ancient Civ)..  If you take lots of notes and never miss class you'll get an A.  Reading the book wasn't necessary.
No Comments
really easy.... no challenge.... just memorize the 30 definitions he gives you and you ace the class.. make sure to go to class that way you wont need a book
Awesome! :)
No Comments
Not the easiest teacher, but his lectures are interesting.  You can't sleep through class and pass his tests, but if you study you'll get an A.  His STS Vietnam class is great.
Wonderful professor. Very clear. Very interesting.
I took his ancient hist. class. Very interesting lectures, but tests are killer.
